intro: Atractylis canescens, commonly known as the hairy centaury, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in meadows and grasslands. It features hairy stems and leaves, and its flowers are usually yellow or orange, attracting various pollinators. Atractylis canescens is also valued for its ornamental qualities and has been used in traditional herbal medicine.
